title: Peasant Mother and Child
medium: drypoint and color aquatint on paper
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Charles J. Rosenbloom
provenance_text:
Harris Whittemore, Naugatuck, CT (Lugt 1384a), until 1927; sale, Parke-Bernet Galleries, Inc., New York,  January 17, 1949, no. 61 [1]; Charles Sessler, Philadelphia, PA [2]; acquired by Department of Fine Arts, Carnegie Institue, Pittsburgh, PA, October 1950.

Notes:
[1]. "The Etched Work of Whistler and Mary Cassatt from the Well-Known Collection of the Late Harris Whittemore, Part I" held on January 17 and 18, 1949.
[2]. J. Leonard Sessler purchased this work as a gift from Charles J. Rosenbloom to the Department of Fine Arts, Carnegie Institute. It was received by the museum on February 4, 1949 but was not accessioned until the following year. See correspondence in curatorial file.
